alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 6:19PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bastrop and west central Fayette Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 619 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Smithville to Rosanky. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smithville, Cistern, Rosanky, Upton, Hills Prairie, Togo, String Prairie, Kovar, Elm Grove, Colony, West Point, and Kirtley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
